Text: Maximum Hourly Flow Cc To calculate maximum hourly allowable volumes the daily firm volume Maximum Daily Quantity or MDQ in the contract is multiplied by the hourly per cent If the per cent is not shown in the contract then the tariff rate of is used Assuming MDQ at is per hour or a daily rate of So at any time the customer can flow at a rate of but cannot exceed for the day An individual delivery point cannot usually drastically affect the mainlines but they can affect smaller laterals Consequently any lateral for this customer would be designed to deliver per hour Shorthand for the daily rate is Multiplying any MDQ by gets the daily rate assuming the max hour is at
